intro: Anaphalis virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its grayish-white, woolly leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Anaphalis virgata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
